name: Aechmea_limae
locality: Ituberá, Fazenda Michelin, Sapucaia, Mata do Pacangê
remarks: Ending of the specific epitet limai was corrected to limae in according with Art. 60.11 Note 4, Ex. 29 and Rec. 60.C.1a of the ICBN (2006)
typeRemarks: Cultivated from  the material collected in May 2004 by Lima

name: Aechmea_linharesiorum
distribution: Santa Terezinha, Pedra Branca, Bahia (Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: [Gandhi 27 Sep 1999] As linharesii; Leme stated (p. 146) that the epithet honors Sandra and Adilson Linhares. The type collection, originally collected by Sandra Linhares and Roberto Menescal in Nov 1994, flowered in cultivation.

name: Alcantarea_roberto-kautskyi
distribution: Baixo Gandu, Espirito Santo (Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: [Gandhi 27 Sep 1999] The type collection, originally collected by W. Zaslawski & E. Colnago, flowered in cultivation.

name: Bromelia_ferox
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Montezuma, North of Minas Gerais State, along the road to Mortugaba, Bahia, in open Cerrado vegetation, 1080 m

name: Cottendorfia_dendritica
reference: Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 18: 31, fig. 1969

name: Cryptanthus_apiculatantherus
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.523.1.6 The specific epithet refers to the apiculate apices of the anthers.

name: Cryptanthus_argyrophyllus
distribution: Santa Cruz da Vitória, Bahia (Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: [Gandhi 7 Jun 2001] Type collection, originally collected by E. Colnago, flowered in cultivation

name: Cryptanthus_brevibracteatus
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.523.1.6 The specific epithet refers to the shorter floral bracts compared to the other species of the genus.

name: Cryptanthus_euglossinii
locality: Miguel Calmon, trail to the waterfall Véu de Noiva, 669 m
remarks: doi:10.1590/2175-7860202273073 Etymology: 'The epithet euglossinii refers to the observed phenomenon of male euglossine bees (Euglossini) visiting the flowers'.

name: Cryptanthus_flesheri
locality: Igrapíuna, BA 001, Mata de Vila 5, Trilha Principal, Reserva Ecológica Michelin, 171 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.523.2.5 The specific epithet honours the ecologist Kevin Michael Flesher, Director of the Reserva Ecológica Michelin and responsible for the conservation and research management of the area where this new species was discovered.
typeRemarks: Originally collected 29 December 2018, flowered in cult.

name: Cryptanthus_lutandensis
collectorTeam: E.H. Souza, M.M. Leodegário, J.G.S. Santos & A. Ferreira
locality: Pindobaçu, Lutanda, Serra da Fumaça, parte superior do Poço das Estrelas, próximo ao acampamento, 870 m

name: Cryptanthus_pirambuensis
typeRemarks: Cultivated from specimen collected on 9 Nov 2017.

name: Cryptanthus_robsonianus
distribution: Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Jaguaré, Palmitinho, Mussununga Córrego do Mosquito, near Fazenda Alegre, 15 m

name: Cryptanthus_santosii
collectorTeam: E. Leme, J.E. Santos & E.H. Souza
locality: Belmonte, BA-275, near to Rio Preto, entrance to the right toward Rio do BU, Comunidade do Canta Galo, 75 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.523.2.5 The name honours its collector, João Eduardo dos Santos, responsible for the preservation of an important fragment of Atlantic Forest in the county of Itapebi, Bahia state, and responsible for several botanical discoveries.

name: Cryptanthus_solidadeanus
locality: Brejões, Distrito de Serrana, Fazenda Camaçari, Mata Camaçari, 875 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.523.2.5 The name honours the local conservationist Maria da Solidade Oliveira da Silva, who called our attention to the high biodiversity in the forest fragments of the Distrito de Serrana, now under serious threat by the expansion of agricultural and cattle breeding activities.

name: Cryptanthus_vinosibracteatus
locality: Itapetinga, Fazenda Santa Cruz, antiga propriedade de Salvador, atualmente de Vardão, 308 m
typeRemarks: Cultivated from specimen collected on 19 Mar 2018.

name: Dyckia_altoana
locality: Northern part of Estado Goiás, south of Alto Paraiso de Goiás, c. 780 m
remarks: The specific epithet refers to the habitat near the city of Alto Paraiso de Goiás.

name: Dyckia_inconspicua
locality: Northeast of Estado Goiás, north of Teresina de Goiás, c. 440 m
remarks: The specific epithet refers to the inconspicuous morphology and growth in the habitat.

name: Dyckia_joanae-marcioi
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: In montibus prope urbem Mato Verde, c. 900m

name: Dyckia_magnifica
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America);Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America);
locality: Santa Catarina: Abdon Batista, Perau do Macaco Branco
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.595.2.4 Etymology: 'The specific epithet “magnifica”, reflects the beauty of the new species. This epithet was created and disseminated by the Dyckia cultivation enthusiast Constantino Gastaldi, who distributed specimens of it to several collectors and botanical collections under this name'.

name: Dyckia_marnier-lapostollei
typeRemarks: Type collection flowered in cultivation at Jardin Botaniques Les Cedres in St. Jean Cap-Ferrat, France

name: Encholirium_josinoi-narcisae
locality: Municipio Monte Alegre de Goiás, 570 m

name: Encholirium_pierre-braunii

name: Fosterella_batistana

typeRemarks: Type specimen, collected by Joao Batista Fernandes da Silva (s.n.), flowered in cultivation

name: Gravisia_costantinii
remarks: Named after Prof Costantin of the Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle, Paris.

name: Hohenbergia_amargosensis
locality: Amargosa, Sítio Renascer, Baixa de Areia, c. 1 km da Cidade, 379 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.567.1.8 Etymology: 'The specific epithet amargosensis refers to the type locality'.
typeLocations: holotype HURB [2 sheets];isotype ALCB;isotype HVASF;isotype RB;isotype R

name: Hohenbergia_densa
distribution: Rio Grande do Norte (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Espírito Santo. Arredores da Mata do pilão, Caatinga aberta próximo das trilhas que levam para gameleira, 36 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.520.2.7 The specific epithet refers to the aspect of the plant, that commonly is seen as a short and robust plant, with a denser inflorescence and primary branches than other Caatinga-endemic species.

name: Hohenbergia_nidularioides
locality: Una, in an unnamed road that connects Una (BA-001) to Beachvilla Martin, 1 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.518.3.2 The specific epithet refers to the inflorescence with a short peduncle and with the branches congested, conferring a nidular-like aspect to the blooming plant.

name: Hohenbergia_ymboreorum
locality: Vitória da Conquista, Rodovia BA-263 - Vitória da Conquista para Itapetinga, 822 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.567.3.7 Etymology: the specific epithet refers to the indigenous tribe called Ymboré, who lived in the area that is now Vitória da Conquista.

name: Hohenmea_× itaipuana
distribution: Niterói, Itaipu, Serra da Tiririca State Park, Morro das Andorinhas, Rio de Janeiro (Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: parents: Aechmea ramosa X Hohenbergia augustae

name: Lymania_involucrata
locality: Igrapiúna, RPPN Ouro verde, Reserva da Michelin, Mata da Vila 5, 35m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.489.2.9 The specific epithet is a reference to the well-developed involucral bracts of the inflorescence, which are an unusual characteristic in the genus and easily allow the identification of the species.

name: Neoregelia_altocaririensis
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Próx. divisa com Bahia, Santa Maria do Salto, Talismã, P.E. do Alto Cariri, Fazenda de Flozino Teixeira, 910 m

name: Neoregelia_silvimontana
publication: Fragm. Atlantic Forest N. E. Brazil
reference: Fragm. Atlantic Forest N. E. Brazil 400 (-403; figs.). 2007 [Apr 2007]
locality: Nova Canaã, Serra da Boa Vista (Oricana), 600-700m

name: Nidularium_ambiguum
remarks: Type collection flowered in cultivation in Dec 1985.

name: Nidularium_bocainensis
remarks: Type collection was originally made by L. C. Gurken et al; flowered in cultivation.
